abstract: The strain, known as serogroup B meningitis, infected students at Princeton and the University of California, Santa Barbara last year.
snippet: The strain, known as serogroup B meningitis, infected students at Princeton and the University of California, Santa Barbara last year.
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration said on Wednesday that it had approved a vaccine for a dangerous strain of meningitis that caused outbreaks last year at Princeton and the University of California, Santa Barbara.

headline.main: F.D.A. Approves Pfizer’s Trumenba, a Vaccine for a Rare Meningitis
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Approves Vaccine for Rare Meningitis
